subject: Sleep
title: Early Morning Awakening
description: A quick, practical guide to Early Morning Awakening.

hook.text: You wake at 3 AM with a heavy feeling of dread. You're exhausted but sleep won't return. This is classic depression.

buildup.text: Early morning awakening is the most specific sleep symptom of major depressive disorder.

discovery.text: Depression advances the circadian rhythm, shifting cortisol release earlier and pulling wake time forward.

twist.text: The early morning hours are when serotonin levels are lowest, making the depressive mood most intense upon waking.

climax.text: This is why depressed patients often feel worst in the morning and slightly better by evening.

punchline.text: Depression steals the last hours of sleep when you need them most.

quiz.question: Why do depressed people often wake very early?
options: They went to bed too early
Depression advances the circadian rhythm and shifts cortisol earlier
